org.numenta.nupic.encoders

Class SparsePassThroughEncoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.numenta.nupic.encoders.Encoder<T>
      • org.numenta.nupic.encoders.PassThroughEncoder<int[]>
        • org.numenta.nupic.encoders.SparsePassThroughEncoder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Persistable

    public class SparsePassThroughEncoder
extends PassThroughEncoder<int[]>
    Sparse Pass Through Encoder Convert a bitmap encoded as array indices to an SDR Each encoding is an SDR in which w out of n bits are turned on. The input should be an array or string of indices to turn on Note: the value for n must equal input length * w i.e. for n=8 w=1 [0,2,5] => 101001000 or for n=8 w=1 "0,2,5" => 101001000 i.e. for n=24 w=3 [0,2,5] => 111000111000000111000000000 or for n=24 w=3 "0,2,5" => 111000111000000111000000000
    Author:
    wilsondy (from Python original)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SparsePassThroughEncoder.Builder
      Returns a Encoder.Builder for constructing SparsePassThroughEncoders

      The base class architecture is put together in such a way where boilerplate initialization can be kept to a minimum for implementing subclasses, while avoiding the mistake-proneness of extremely long argument lists.

        public void encodeIntoArray(int[] input,
